intro: Heterospathe micrantha, commonly known as the small-flowered arrowhead, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Araceae family, characterized by its distinctive inflorescence known as a spadix, surrounded by a modified leaf called a spathe. The plant typically features broad, arrowhead-shaped leaves that are often submerged or floating in aquatic environments. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are adapted for pollination by insects, and it is often found in marshy or wetland habitats. Due to its unique morphology and ecological role, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
